title: Update on n8n cloud accounts in Russia and Belarus
excerpt: Due to the ongoing war in Ukraine, we have stopped accepting new n8n.cloud customers from Russia and Belarus.
html:
Along with the rest of the world, we are shocked by the war in Ukraine and we condemn the Russian invasion.

At n8n, we try to be fair with everything we do and our community is everything. And while we understand that many citizens in Russia and Belarus did not ask for this war and don’t agree with it, we want to make sure that none of our business actions are helping finance this war.

Therefore, from March 7th, we have stopped accepting new cloud customers from Russia and Belarus. Our current customers in these countries will have 60 days to migrate their n8n cloud instances and we will no longer be taking further payments from these countries.

This will not change access to our site, resources, or access to our desktop app or source code to self-host. We will continue to provide support to all of our community members in our forum regardless of their nationality or country of origin.

We stand in solidarity with everyone affected by the events in Ukraine and make an open appeal for peace.

readme:
Along with the rest of the world, we are shocked by the war in Ukraine and we condemn the Russian invasion.

At n8n, we try to be fair with everything we do and our community is everything. And while we understand that many citizens in Russia and Belarus did not ask for this war and don’t agree with it, we want to make sure that none of our business actions are helping finance this war.

Therefore, **from March 7th, we have stopped accepting new cloud customers from Russia and Belarus**. Our current customers in these countries will have 60 days to migrate their n8n cloud instances and we will no longer be taking further payments from these countries.

This will not change access to our site, resources, or access to our desktop app or source code to self-host. We will continue to provide support to all of our community members in our forum regardless of their nationality or country of origin.

We stand in solidarity with everyone affected by the events in Ukraine and make an open appeal for peace.
